009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.utils;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
012import static java.lang.Math.PI;
013
014import java.util.Random;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
018
019/**
020 * Utility class for picking random points on a given ellipse. 
021 * @author WB
022 *
023 */
024public class EllipseSampler {
025        
026        private final Random rg;
027        
028        private final GeometricEllipse ellipse;
029        
030        public EllipseSampler(GeometricEllipse ellipse) {
031                this.ellipse = ellipse;
032                this.rg = new Random();
033        }
034        
035        public EllipseSampler(GeometricEllipse ellipse, long seed) {
036                this.ellipse = ellipse;
037                this.rg = new Random(seed);
038        }
039        
040        /**
041         * Creates and returns an array of 2D points sampled on 
042         * the ellipse associated with this {@link EllipseSampler}.
043         * Random Gaussian noise (with standard deviation sigma)
044         * is added to the individual x/y coordinates.
045         * 
046         * @param n number of points
047         * @param startAngle initial angle (radians)
048         * @param arcAngle arc angle (radians)
049         * @param sigma amount of random noise
050         * @return an array of sample points
051         */
052        public Pnt2d[] getPoints(int n, double startAngle, double arcAngle, double sigma) {
053                Pnt2d[] points = new Pnt2d[n];
054                                
055                double xc = ellipse.xc;
056                double yc = ellipse.yc;
057                double ra = ellipse.ra;
058                double rb = ellipse.rb;
059                double theta = ellipse.theta;
060                
061                startAngle = mod(startAngle, 2 * PI);   
062                arcAngle   = mod(arcAngle, 2 * PI);
063                if (arcAngle == 0)
064                        arcAngle = 2 * PI;
065
066//              double dAngle;
067//              if (endAngle > startAngle) {
068//                      dAngle = endAngle - startAngle;
069//              }
070//              else if (endAngle < startAngle) {
071//                      dAngle = endAngle + 2 * PI - startAngle;
072//              }
073//              else {  // endAngle == startAngle
074//                      dAngle = 2 * PI;
075//              }
076
077                final double cosTh = Math.cos(theta);
078                final double sinTh = Math.sin(theta);
079                
080                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
081                        double alpha = startAngle + arcAngle * i / n;
082                        double x0 = ra * Math.cos(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
083                        double y0 = rb * Math.sin(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
084                        double x = x0 * cosTh - y0 * sinTh + xc;
085                        double y = x0 * sinTh + y0 * cosTh + yc;
086                        points[i] = Pnt2d.from(x, y);
087                }
088                return points;
089        }
090
091}
